education.summary: Joint PhD at the University of Cambridge and the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems. PhD thesis with topic Advancing Normalising Flows to Model Boltzmann Distributions supervised by Prof. José Miguel Hernández-Lobato and Prof. Bernhard Schölkopf.
Master thesis with topic Inferring the Band Structure from Band Mapping Data through Machine Learning supervised by Prof. Bernhard Schölkopf. Final grade: 1.0 (best possible).
Bachelor thesis with topic Optimal Dynamic Adaptation of Microorganism in Changing Environments supervised by Prof. Ulrich Gerland. Final grade: 1.0 (best possible).

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
